Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please supply all diagrams and drawings relating to the road layout, road markings, signage and construction of the Arundel Gate Bus Gate. This also includes the road leading to the bus gate from (and including) the Arundel Gate/Furnival Square roundabout.
Yours faithfully,
Daniel Jackson

Dear Daniel Jackson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Arundel Gate Bus
Gate which we received on 18/05/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 16/06/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
Can you please explain why this is being treated as a request under the Environmental regulations?
My request clearly pertains to drawing, diagrams etc of road layout, road furniture, road signage. While the purported aim of the Arundel Gate bus gate is a reduction in pollution that is not relevant to my request?
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson

Dear FOI,
I’d like to request an internal review into the handling of my request.
Firstly my FOI request was treated as an Environmental request with no explanation as to why.
Secondly, I am yet to receive the information despite the legal time limit having expired.
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson

Dear Daniel Jackson,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to
Arundel Gate Bus Gate which we received on 14/07/2023. We are sorry to
hear that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Code of Practice – Environmental Information Regulations 2004 states
that we must respond to your request for internal review within 40 working
days, by 11/09/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email
address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
I’d like to request an internal review into the handling of my request.
Firstly my FOI request was treated as an Environmental request with no
explanation as to why.
Secondly, I am yet to receive the information despite the legal time limit
having expired.
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson
show quoted sections

Dear FOI,
Please take this email as a request to raise an official complaint.
My original FOI request (which you chose to make an Environmental information request) is now several months late with no information received.
My request for an internal review of the handling of my request is now also overdue.
You have failed to discharge your duties under the law.
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson

Dear FOI,
Another 11 days have passed and I am still yet to receive the response to my initial FOI request, any response to my queries, a response to my request to an internal review or an acknowledgement of my complaint.
You leave me no option but to raise a complaint with the ICO and to open a case via the small claims court for damages in relation to the anxiety and distress repeatedly chasing you for information has caused through your complete disregard for your legal duties.
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson

Dear FOI,
Three months. No information, no internal review.
Anything to say for yourself?
Yours sincerely,
Daniel Jackson

Dear Daniel Jackson
Thank you for your request of 14 July 2023 regarding an internal review of
our handling of your request of 18 May 2023 for diagrams and drawings
relating to the road layout, road markings, signage and construction of
the Arundel Gate Bus Gate. This also includes the road leading to the bus
gate from (and including) the Arundel Gate/Furnival Square roundabout.
Most recently you contacted us on 18 October 2023 to find out about your
response.
We apologise for the delay in processing your request which was an
administrative oversight. We partially uphold your complaint because we
have breached the Code of Practice under Regulation 16 of the
Environmental Information Regulation 2004, which states that organisations
should respond to a complainant within 40 working days from the time when
the complaint was received. We sincerely apologise for the delay on this
occasion, but we have had a significant backlog of requests that is taking
us a long time to get through.
We processed this request under the EIR because information which bears
upon the environment is exempt under section 39 of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000. Regulation 2(1)(a) provides a definition of
environmental information. See: [1]Regulation 2(1) - What is environmental
information? | ICO Our view was that your request met the criterion in (c)
as it was for a “plan”(s). The public authority then needs to process it
under the EIR, which is similar, but contains different provisions to the
FOI.
We are attaching the requested information.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
